dialogue.text: 「Aren’t you listening, Narcissa? Oh, he’ll try, I’m sure. . . . The usual empty words, the usual slithering out of action . . . oh, on the Dark Lord’s orders, of course!」

「Ah, Bellatrix, always so quick to judge and criticize. But let me remind you, I have faithfully carried out the Dark Lord's orders for years, even at great personal risk. My loyalty is unquestionable, unlike some others.」
「And, should it prove necessary . . . if it seems Draco will fail . . . will you carry out the deed that the Dark Lord has ordered Draco to perform?」
「I will.」
「Snapeaction」

"Potter, you insolent fool! How dare you interrupt me in the presence of the Dark Lord! Do you think your pitiful attempts at heroism will make any difference? You are nothing but a pawn in this grand game, and your fate is sealed. Now, be silent and let the adults speak."
「Lilyaction」
"Lily, I... I didn't mean for it to come out like that. It was a moment of anger, a slip of the tongue. I never should have called you that. Please, forgive me."
「It was Dark Magic, and if you think that’s funny —」
「Funny? No, I assure you, I find nothing amusing about Dark Magic. It is a dangerous and destructive force that should not be taken lightly.」
「I know your theory, Why are you so obsessed with them anyway? Why do you care what they’re doing at night?」

「I care because I have a duty to maintain order and discipline in this school. It is my responsibility to ensure that students follow the rules and do not engage in reckless behavior. As for my so-called obsession, it is merely a matter of vigilance and upholding the standards of Hogwarts.」
「Let me? Let me?」
「I didn’t mean — I just don’t want to see you made a fool of — He fancies you, James Potter fancies you! And he’s not . . . everyone thinks . . . big Quidditch hero —」
「I’m sorry.」
「Sorry? Sorry for what? Sorry that you exist? Sorry that I despise you? Sorry that I have to endure your presence day after day?」
「But if — if there was a mistake —」
「KEEP QUIET, YOU STUPID GIRL! DON’T TALK ABOUT WHAT YOU DON’T UNDERSTAND! A few sparks shot out of the end of his wand, which was still pointed at Black’s face. Hermione fell silent.」

「Professor Lupin could have killed me about a hundred times this year, I’ve been alone with him loads of times, having defense lessons against the dementors. If he was helping Black, why didn’t he just finish me off then?」
「Don’t ask me to fathom the way a werewolf’s mind works, Potter.」
「Yeah, ghosts are transparent, but Inferi are dead bodies, aren’t they? So they’d be solid —」

「A five-year-old could have told us as much, Mr. Potter. The Inferius is a corpse that has been reanimated by a Dark wizard's spells. It is not alive, it is merely used like a puppet to do the wizard's bidding. A ghost, as I trust that you are all aware by now, is the imprint of a departed soul left upon the earth... and of course, as you so astutely pointed out, transparent.」

「Well, what Harry said is the most useful if we’re trying to tell them apart! When we come face-to-face with one down a dark alley, we’re going to be having a shufti to see if it’s solid, aren’t we, we’re not going to be asking, ‘Excuse me, are you the imprint of a departed soul?’」
「Another ten points from Gryffindor, I would expect nothing more sophisticated from you, Ronald Weasley, the boy so solid he cannot Apparate half an inch across a room.」
「That was because you were knocked out, Professor! You didn’t arrive in time to hear —」
「Miss Granger, HOLD YOUR TONGUE!」
「The dementors should have arrived by now, I’ll go and meet them. Dumbledore, I’ll see you upstairs」
「You surely don’t believe a word of Black’s story?」
「He filed into the classroom behind Ron and Hermione and followed them to their usual table at the back, ignoring the huffy, irritable noises now issuing from both of them.」
"Settle down, Potter. I trust you are prepared for today's lesson, or shall I expect another display of your usual incompetence?"
「Good afternoon.」
「Good afternoon, Miss Granger. I trust you have a legitimate reason for interrupting my class?」

「Not today, Mr. Weasley, said Dumbledore. But I must impress upon both of you the seriousness of what you have done. I will be writing to both your families tonight. I must also warn you that if you do anything like this again, I will have no choice but to expel you.」

「Indeed, Dumbledore. These reckless actions cannot go unpunished. We must ensure that these young troublemakers understand the gravity of their actions and the consequences that await them if they dare to repeat such foolishness.」
「Harry and Ronaction」
「Silence!」
Harry and Ronaction
「Snapefully grown, adult-sized Snape standing right beside him, white with rage」
「You dare to question my certainty? I assure you, I have my ways of knowing things.」
「Do not waste my time with your feeble protests, Potter. The Dark Lord's return is imminent, and I have a duty to fulfill here at Hogwarts. Now, go.」
「No, of course I w —」
「Clearly, you pay about as much attention in my class as a sleeping troll.」
「Draco, do it or stand aside so one of us —」
「We’ve got a problem, Snape, the boy doesn’t seem able —Severus . . .」
「How do you know? Is this just Professor Dumbledore guessing, or — ?」
「I told you, to call me ‘sir.’ Yes, Potter, it is true that Professor Dumbledore has made certain deductions.」
「Yes, sir, but how do you know — ?」
「I have my ways, Potter. I always know more than you think. Now, get to your seats and behave.」

「He felt a sharp pain in his knee. Snape’s office had come back into view and he realized that he had fallen to the floor; one of his knees had collided painfully with the leg of Snape’s desk. He looked up at Snape, who had lowered his wand and was rubbing his wrist. There was an angry weal there, like a scorch mark.」
「Did you mean to produce a Stinging Hex?」
「Harryaction」
"Detention, Potter. And don't think I haven't noticed your little sidekick's involvement as well. Five points from Gryffindor for your reckless behavior."

「Right, Professor. I thought you could start with boxes one thousand and twelve to one thousand and fifty-six. You will find some familiar names in there, which should add interest to the task. Here, you see . . . He pulled out a card from one of the topmost boxes with a flourish and read, ‘James Potter and Sirius Black. Apprehended using an illegal hex upon Bertram Aubrey. Aubrey’s head twice normal size. Double detention.’ It must be such a comfort to think that, though they are gone, a record of their great achievements remains. . . .」
「I think that will do. Mark the place you have reached. You will continue at ten o’clock next Saturday.」
「Miss Granger, I suggest you do as I say.」
「He can read minds?」

「You have no subtlety, Potter. You do not understand fine distinctions. It is one of the shortcomings that makes you such a lamentable potion-maker. Only Muggles talk of ‘mind reading.’ The mind is not a book, to be opened at will and examined at leisure. Thoughts are not etched on the inside of skulls, to be perused by any invader. The mind is a complex and many-layered thing, Potter . . . or at least, most minds are . . . It is true, however, that those who have mastered Legilimency are able, under certain conditions, to delve into the minds of their victims and to interpret their findings correctly. The Dark Lord, for instance, almost always knows when somebody is lying to him. Only those skilled at Occlumency are able to shut down those feelings and memories that contradict the lie, and so utter falsehoods in his presence without detection.」
「So he could know what we’re thinking right now? Sir?」

「The Dark Lord is at a considerable distance and the walls and grounds of Hogwarts are guarded by many ancient spells and charms to ensure the bodily and mental safety of those who dwell within them. Time and space matter in magic, Potter. Eye contact is often essential to Legilimency.」
「finally cracked and flung a large, slippery crocodile heart at Malfoy, which hit him in the face」

"Detention, Weasley! Ten points from Gryffindor for your reckless and foolish behavior. You will report to my office immediately after classes. And as for you, Malfoy, clean yourself up and stop provoking your fellow students. This is not a playground for your childish pranks."
「Severus, you know what I must ask you to do. If you are ready . . . if you are prepared . . .」
「I am.」
「Wherever you told them to be, I expect, Severus」
「I was under the impression that Alecto had apprehended an intruder.」
「You have some objection?」
「I have no objection, Minerva.」
「There is no need to stand guard over him anymore, Dumbledore! The Minister has seen to that!」

「Minister or no Minister, Potter is not to be trusted. His reckless behavior and disregard for rules have caused enough trouble already. It is clear that he is a magnet for danger and chaos. We cannot afford to let our guard down, regardless of what the Minister may say.」
「Mum, shut up! It’s okay!」
"Silence, Weasley! Your mother's presence is not required here. I will handle this situation accordingly."

「I think you’ve got enough to be getting on with at the moment. I’ve become accustomed to seeing the Quidditch Cup in my study, boys, and I really don’t want to have to hand it over to Professor Snape, so use the extra time to practice, won’t you?」

「I assure you, Professor McGonagall, I have no interest in your precious Quidditch Cup. I have more important matters to attend to than indulging in such trivialities. However, if you insist on wasting your time with these Gryffindor miscreants, then by all means, let them practice to their heart's content. Just don't expect any favors from me when they inevitably fail.」
「It’s the property of the champion he stole it from. Hand it over, now.」

「Do you honestly think that I would hand over something without a proper reason? I am not one to be commanded, Moody. If you have any concerns about the ownership of this item, I suggest you take it up with the proper authorities.」

「Full of Dark Magic? Do you really think so, Severus? It looks to me as though it is merely a piece of parchment that insults anybody who reads it. Childish, but surely not dangerous? I imagine Harry got it from a joke shop —」
「Indeed? You think a joke shop could supply him with such a thing? You don’t think it more likely that he got it directly from the manufacturers?」
「said "Oh, now, Severus, it’s Christmas, don’t be too hard —"」
「I’m his Head of House, and I shall decide how hard, or otherwise, to be. Follow me, Draco.」
「“He was provoked, Professor Snape, Malfoy was insultin’ his family.”」
「Be that as it may, fighting is against Hogwarts rules, Hagrid. Five points from Gryffindor, Weasley, and be grateful it isn’t more. Move along, all of you.」
「I would’ve had Crabbe and Goyle with me if you hadn’t put them in detention!」

「Keep your voice down! If your friends Crabbe and Goyle intend to pass their Defense Against the Dark Arts O.W.L. this time around, they will need to work a little harder than they are doing at present. As for your complaint, Potter, I have no interest in your petty excuses. Detention is a consequence of your own actions, and it is not my concern if you lack suitable companions for your misadventures. Now, be gone before I deduct more points from Gryffindor for your insolence.」
「What does it matter? Defense Against the Dark Arts — it’s all just a joke, isn’t it, an act? Like any of us need protecting against the Dark Arts —」

「It is an act that is crucial to success, Draco! Where do you think I would have been all these years, if I had not known how to act? Now listen to me! You are being incautious, wandering around at night, getting yourself caught, and if you are placing your reliance in assistants like Crabbe and Goyle —」
「I know what you’re up to! You want to steal my glory!」

「You are speaking like a child. I assure you, Mr. Malfoy, stealing your glory is the least of my concerns. My only interest lies in ensuring that you and your classmates receive a proper education in Defense Against the Dark Arts. Now, enough with your baseless accusations and focus on the task at hand.」
「The prophecy did not refer to a woman. It spoke of a boy born at the end of July —」
「You know what I mean! He thinks it means her son, he is going to hunt her down — kill them all —」
「If she means so much to you, surely Lord Voldemort will spare her? Could you not ask for mercy for the mother, in exchange for the son?」
「I have — I have asked him —Hide them all, then. Keep her — them — safe. Please.」

「I thought . . . you were going . . . to keep her . . . safe. . . .Her son lives. He has her eyes, precisely her eyes. You remember the shape and color of Lily Evans’s eyes, I am sure?I wish . . . I wish I were dead. . . .」
「You know how and why she died. Make sure it was not in vain. Help me protect Lily’s son.」
「He does not need protection. The Dark Lord has gone —」
「If she means so much to you, surely Lord Voldemort will spare her? Could you not ask for mercy for the mother, in exchange for the son?」
「I have asked him.」
「Something was making a terrible sound, like a wounded animal.」
「Silence!」
「You know how and why she died. Make sure it was not in vain. Help me protect Lily’s son.」
「He does not need protection. The Dark Lord has gone —」
「I’m trying to decide what curse to use on Malfoy, sir,」
「Put that wand away at once, Ten points from Gryff —」
「Yes, Professor Snape, I’m quite as good as new. You two — Crabbe — Goyle —Oh — well — I suppose . . .」
「Snapelooked toward the giant hourglasses on the walls and gave a sneering smile」

「Ah, yes. The illustrious James Potter, always the center of attention, basking in his Quidditch triumphs. A true embodiment of arrogance and disregard for rules. But let me remind you, Potter, that greatness is not measured by the number of Quidditch Cups one has won, but by the character and integrity one possesses. Your father may have been a skilled player, but he lacked the humility and respect that truly define a noble wizard.」
「He must have Disapparated, Severus. We should have left somebody in the room with him. When this gets out —」
「HE DIDN’T DISAPPARATE! YOU CAN’T APPARATE OR DISAPPARATE INSIDE THIS CASTLE! THIS — HAS — SOMETHING — TO — DO — WITH — POTTER!」
「See here, Snape, be reasonable. This door’s been locked, we just saw —」
「THEY HELPED HIM ESCAPE, I KNOW IT!」
「“I thought Snape and Mundungus were on the same side,” muttered Harry to Ron and Hermione. “Shouldn’t he be upset Mundungus has been arrest —”」

「But Potter seems to have a lot to say on the subject,” said Snape, pointing suddenly at the back of the room, his black eyes fixed on Harry. “Let us ask Potter how we would tell the difference between an Inferius and a ghost.”
「You asked me to come directly to you, Professor, if anyone was wandering around at night, and somebody’s been in the library — Restricted Section.」
「The Restricted Section? Well, they can’t be far, we’ll catch them.」
「I’ve warned you, Snivellus, I don’t care if Dumbledore thinks you’ve reformed, I know better —」

「Ah, Black, still as arrogant and ignorant as ever, I see. Your blind loyalty to Potter and your delusions about my true intentions are truly amusing. But rest assured, I have no interest in your opinions or your warnings. Dumbledore's trust in me is not for you to question.」
「Ronno dialogue, reaction to Hermione's condition」
「I don't know what to believe anymore. But Hermione... she needs help. We can't just ignore what she's going through.」
「Potter attacked me, sir — We attacked each other at the same time! — and he hit Goyle — look —」
「Hospital wing, Goyle.」
「Several peopleaction」
"I assure you, I have no interest in spying on the likes of you. My presence here is purely coincidental."
「Rubbish! He saw my Kwikspell letter!」
「Mr. Filch, your Kwikspell letter is of no concern to me. I have more pressing matters to attend to.」
「Ronstomach gave a huge rumble」

"Silence, Weasley! Your stomach's growling is hardly relevant to the matter at hand. Focus on the issue at hand, Potter's suspicious behavior. How can we be sure he is telling the truth about his whereabouts and intentions? It is clear that he and his friends were up to something, sneaking around the castle instead of attending the Halloween feast. I propose that until Potter provides a satisfactory explanation, he should face consequences for his actions, such as being removed from the Gryffindor Quidditch team."
「I sought a third wand, Severus. The Elder Wand, the Wand of Destiny, the Deathstick. I took it from its previous master. I took it from the grave of Albus Dumbledore.」

「So, you have finally acquired the Elder Wand, have you, Voldemort? You always did have a penchant for power and control. But let me remind you, the wand chooses the wizard. It may not be as loyal to you as you think.」
「The staffroom door banged open again. For one wild moment, Harry was sure it would be Dumbledore. But it was Lockhart, and he was beaming.」
「Ah, Lockhart, the epitome of self-importance and incompetence. Pray, enlighten us with your latest triumph, if you must.」
「D-did I? I don’t recall —」
「Clearly, your memory is as feeble as your magical abilities, Flitwick.」
「Nevillepotion turned」

「Well, well, well, Longbottom. It seems you have once again managed to bungle a simple potion. How many times must I remind you of the correct instructions? Clearly, your incompetence knows no bounds.Miss Granger, I specifically instructed you not to assist Longbottom. Your blatant disregard for my orders has resulted in a deduction of five points from Gryffindor. Perhaps next time you will think twice before interfering.Class dismissed. I have wasted enough of my valuable time on your ineptitude.」
「please, I could help Neville put it right —」

「I don’t remember asking you to show off, Miss Granger. Longbottom, at the end of this lesson we will feed a few drops of this potion to your toad and see what happens. Perhaps that will encourage you to do it properly.」
「Well, well, well,」
「Nice of you to turn up, Potter, although you have evidently decided that the wearing of school robes would detract from your appearance.」
「I couldn’t change, I didn’t have my —」
「There is no need to wait, Nymphadora, Potter is quite — ah — safe in my hands.」
「Stop skulking and come and join us, Severus! I was just talking about Harry’s exceptional potion-making! Some credit must go to you, of course, you taught him for five years!」
「Funny, I never had the impression that I managed to teach Potter anything at all.」

「Well, then, it’s natural ability! You should have seen what he gave me, first lesson, Draught of Living Death — never had a student produce finer on a first attempt, I don’t think even you, Severus —」
「Really?All the subjects required, in short, for an Auror.」

「Well, then, it’s natural ability! You should have seen what he gave me, first lesson, Draught of Living Death — never had a student produce finer on a first attempt, I don’t think even you, Severus —」
「Funny, I never had the impression that I managed to teach Potter anything at all.」

「Lockhart think "There you have it! That was a Disarming Charm — as you see, I’ve lost my wand — ah, thank you, Miss Brown — yes, an excellent idea to show them that, Professor Snape, but if you don’t mind my saying so, it was very obvious what you were about to do. If I had wanted to stop you it would have been only too easy — however, I felt it would be instructive to let them see . . ."」
「Enough demonstrating! I’m going to come amongst you now and put you all into pairs. Professor Snape, if you’d like to help me —」
「Time to split up the dream team, I think. Weasley, you can partner Finnigan. Potter —」
「Mr. Malfoy, come over here. Let’s see what you make of the famous Potter. And you, Miss Granger — you can partner Miss Bulstrode.」
「Time to split up the dream team, I think. Weasley, you can partner Finnigan. Potter —」
「Mr. Malfoy, come over here. Let’s see what you make of the famous Potter. And you, Miss Granger — you can partner Miss Bulstrode.」
「Sorry I’m late, Professor Lupin, I —」
「This lesson began ten minutes ago, Potter, so I think we’ll make it ten points from Gryffindor. Sit down.」
「Where’s Professor Lupin?」
「That is none of your concern, Potter. Focus on your own studies and leave the whereabouts of the staff to me.」
「But, sir, we’re not supposed to do werewolves yet, we’re due to start hinkypunks —」
「Miss Granger, I was under the impression that I am teaching this lesson, not you. And I am telling you all to turn to page 394. All of you! Now!」
「Nevillebroke off with a small gasp, looking over Harry’s shoulder」
「And what are you two doing here? An odd place to meet —」
「We’re not — meeting here. We just — met here.」
「You have a habit of turning up in unexpected places, Potter, and you are very rarely there for no reason. . . . I suggest the pair of you return to Gryffindor Tower, where you belong.」
「We’re not — meeting here. We just — met here.」
「You have a habit of turning up in unexpected places, Potter, and you are very rarely there for no reason. . . . I suggest the pair of you return to Gryffindor Tower, where you belong.」
「Severus, you’re making a mistake, You haven’t heard everything — I can explain — Sirius is not here to kill Harry —」
「Two more for Azkaban tonight, I shall be interested to see how Dumbledore takes this. . . . He was quite convinced you were harmless, you know, Lupin . . . a tame werewolf —」
「Follow me.」
「Do not presume to give me orders, Potter. I am well aware of your nocturnal activities and I will not tolerate any further trespassing into my domain. Consider yourself warned.」
「We are at an advantage there, my Lord, We now have several people planted within the Department of Magical Transport. If Potter Apparates or uses the Floo Network, we shall know immediately.」
「He will not do either, The Order is eschewing any form of transport that is controlled or regulated by the Ministry; they mistrust everything to do with the place.」
「Harrydidn’t speak」
「Exactly. Our new lesson will focus on nonverbal spells. Pay attention, Potter, if you can manage that for once.」
「Maybe he’d better go to Madam Pomfrey. If he’s seeing things like —」
「Potter, I assure you that Mr. Malfoy is not having hallucinations.」
「I’ve been up in Gryffindor Tower, like you told —」
「Can anyone confirm that?」

「Harry think "His lightheartedness was short-lived. There were Slytherin taunts to be endured next day, not to mention much anger from fellow Gryffindors, who were most unhappy that their Captain had got himself banned from the final match of the season. By Saturday morning, whatever he might have told Hermione, Harry would have gladly exchanged all the Felix Felicis in the world to be walking down to the Quidditch pitch with Ron, Ginny, and the others. It was almost unbearable to turn away from the mass of students streaming out into the sunshine, all of them wearing rosettes and hats and brandishing banners and scarves, to descend the stone steps into the dungeons and walk until the distant sounds of the crowd were quite obliterated, knowing that he would not be able to hear a word of commentary or a cheer or groan."」

「Ah, Potter, when Harry had knocked on his door and entered the unpleasantly familiar office that Snape, despite teaching floors above now, had not vacated; it was as dimly lit as ever and the same slimy dead objects were suspended in colored potions all around the walls. Ominously, there were many cobwebbed boxes piled on a table where Harry was clearly supposed to sit; they had an aura of tedious, hard, and pointless work about them. Mr. Filch has been looking for someone to clear out these old files. They are the records of other Hogwarts wrongdoers and their punishments. Where the ink has grown faint, or the cards have suffered damage from mice, we would like you to copy out the crimes and punishments afresh and, making sure that they are in alphabetical order, replace them in the boxes. You will not use magic. I thought you could start with boxes one thousand and twelve to one thousand and fifty-six. You will find some familiar names in there, which should add interest to the task. Here, you see . . . He pulled out a card from one of the topmost boxes with a flourish and read, ‘James Potter and Sirius Black. Apprehended using an illegal hex upon Bertram Aubrey. Aubrey’s head twice normal size. Double detention.’ It must be such a comfort to think that, though they are gone, a record of their great achievements remains. . . .」

「But why does Professor Dumbledore want to stop it? I don’t like it much, but it’s been useful, hasn’t it? I mean . . . I saw that snake attack Mr. Weasley and if I hadn’t, Professor Dumbledore wouldn’t have been able to save him, would he? Sir?」

「It appears that the Dark Lord has been unaware of the connection between you and himself until very recently. Up till now it seems that you have been experiencing his emotions and sharing his thoughts without his being any the wiser. However, the vision you had shortly before Christmas —」
「The one with the snake and Mr. Weasley?」
「Do not interrupt me, Potter. As I was saying . . . the vision you had shortly before Christmas represented such a powerful incursion upon the Dark Lord’s thoughts —」
「How come I saw through the snake’s eyes if it’s Voldemort’s thoughts I’m sharing?」
「Do not say the Dark Lord’s name!」
「I just wanted to know, why —」
「You seem to have visited the snake’s mind because that was where the Dark Lord was at that particular moment. He was possessing the snake at the time and so you dreamed you were inside it too . . .」
「The one with the snake and Mr. Weasley?」

「Do not interrupt me, Potter. As I was saying... the vision you had shortly before Christmas represented such a powerful incursion upon the Dark Lord's thoughts. It appears that the Dark Lord has been unaware of the connection between you and himself until very recently. Up till now, it seems that you have been experiencing his emotions and sharing his thoughts without his being any the wiser. However, the vision you had, the one with the snake and Mr. Weasley, was a result of the Dark Lord possessing the snake at that particular moment. You inadvertently entered the snake's mind because it was where the Dark Lord was present. Do you understand now, or shall I continue to enlighten you, Potter?」
「How come I saw through the snake’s eyes if it’s Voldemort’s thoughts I’m sharing?」
「Do not interrupt me, Potter. As I was saying . . . the vision you had shortly before Christmas represented such a powerful incursion upon the Dark Lord’s thoughts —」
「I just wanted to know, why —」
「Why? Why did you want to know?」
「d-don’t know why you wanted t-t-to meet here of all p-places, Severus . . .」
「Oh, I thought we’d keep this private. Students aren’t supposed to know about the Sorcerer’s Stone, after all.」
「B-b-but Severus, I —」
「You don’t want me as your enemy, Quirrell.」
「B-b-but Severus, I —」
「You don’t want me as your enemy, Quirrell.」

「saw a man lying before him, pale-skinned, slightly freckled, with a mop of fair hair. He knew who he was. He had seen him in Dumbledore’s Pensieve, had watched him being led away from court by the dementors, trying to convince Mr. Crouch that he was innocent . . . but he was lined around the eyes now and looked much older. . . .」
「Crouch!」
「Good heavens,」
「Master Barty, Master Barty, what is you doing here?」
「He is simply Stunned, Winky. Step aside, please. Severus, you have the potion?」
「Yes,」
「He is simply Stunned, Winky. Step aside, please. Severus, you have the potion?」
「Yes, Headmaster.」

「Harry and Ron stared at each other, white-faced. Harry didn’t feel hungry anymore. He now felt extremely sick. He tried not to look at a large, slimy something suspended in green liquid on a shelf behind Snape’s desk. If Snape had gone to fetch Professor McGonagall, head of Gryffindor House, they were hardly any better off. She might be fairer than Snape, but she was still extremely strict.」
「Ten points from Gryffindor for your insolence, Potter. And as for you, Weasley, I suggest you keep your mouth shut if you know what's good for you.」
「Get back to bed, Snape.」
「I will go back to bed when I am ready, Moody. Your attempts to command me hold no sway.」
「Snapespell to Marauder's Map」
「Potter! That egg is Potter’s egg. That piece of parchment belongs to Potter. I have seen it before, I recognize it! Potter is here! Potter, in his Invisibility Cloak!」
「Meaning that Dumbledore’s very interested to know who’s got it in for that boy! And so am I, Snape . . . very interested. . . .」

「You dare to question my loyalty, Moody? I have dedicated my life to protecting Harry Potter, even when it meant going against my own desires. I will not stand for any insinuations against my intentions.」

「said "Who suspects me? For the last time, I didn’t do it, okay? That Bell girl must’ve had an enemy no one knows about — don’t look at me like that! I know what you’re doing, I’m not stupid, but it won’t work — I can stop you!"」
「Ah . . . Aunt Bellatrix has been teaching you Occlumency, I see. What thoughts are you trying to conceal from your master, Draco?」
